00034 /**********************************************
00035 Class Name: TreeVisitor
00036 Class Description: The TreeVisitor class is used to visit (iterate over) each item in the Tree which is created by 
00037 reading in a file in PDI format.  When a node on the tree is visited, an instruction is created 
00038 in the Instruction Tree.  The Wireshark dissector will use the instruction tree created by this class.
00039 
00040 Usage: After a file has been read in by calling the following parser functions...
00041       Element elemRoot = DisplayElement();
00042       Reader::Read(elemRoot, std::ifstream("AvatarsInRoom.txt"));
00043 then the following function can be called to create an instruction tree.
00044       TreeVisitor treeVisitor(elemRoot.Name());
00045 Note that the root element name must be passed into the TreeVisitor in order to get the first
00046 name from the file to be included in the first instruction in the instruction tree.
00047 
00048 If a second parameter is provided, which is boolean, this will be used to determine if 
00049 unit test / debug data should be written to cout.  If the parameter is true then data will
00050 be displayed.  If the parameter is false, or is not provided, then data will not be displayed.
00051 
00052 ***********************************************/
00053 class TreeVisitor : public PDI::ConstVisitor
00054 {
00055 public:
00056 /*type     := 'UINT'
00057          |  'INT'
00058          |  'BOOL'
00059          |  'FLOAT'
00060          |  'ASCII'
00061          |  'PAD'
00062          |  array
00063 */
00064 
00065 /**********************
00066 Function Name: TreeVisitor(const std::string& sName, bool bDisplayOutputToScreen = false)
00067 Function Description: This is the constructor for TreeVisitor class.
00068 
00069 First parameter should be the name of the root node.
00070 Second parameter is optional.  It should be true if you want output to the screen for testing.
00071 
00072 A function map is initialized in the constructor using a template.
00073 This will make the addition of new types easier.
00074 
00075 ***********************/
00076    TreeVisitor(const std::string& sName, bool bDisplayOutputToScreen = false) : 
00077       m_sName(sName),
00078       m_bDisplayOutputToScreen(bDisplayOutputToScreen),
00079       m_pInstruction(0)
00080    {
00081       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["INT"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::IntElement>;
00082       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["UINT"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::UintElement>;
00083       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["BOOL"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::BoolElement>;
00084       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["FLOAT"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::FloatElement>;
00085       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["ASCII"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::AsciiElement>;
00086       m_CreateInstructionFuncMap["PAD"] = &TreeVisitor::CreateInstruction<BabelShark::PadElement>;
00087    }
00088 
00089    /**********************
00090    Function Name: BabelShark::Instruction* GetInstruction() 
00091    Function Description: This function returns a pointer to an instruction.
00092    ***********************/
00093    BabelShark::Instruction* GetInstruction() { return m_pInstruction; }
00094 
00095 private:
00096    /**********************
00097    Function Name: BabelShark::Instruction* CreateInstruction(unsigned int nSize, const std::string& sName)
00098    Function Description: This function uses a template to reduce code size and to make it easier to
00099    add new types.  There are 3 pieces of data that an instruction needs: name, type, size.
00100    Size and name are passed in as parameters.  The Type is known because this is a template function
00101    and it is InstructionTypeT.
00102    ***********************/
00103    template <typename InstructionTypeT>
00104    BabelShark::Instruction* CreateInstruction(unsigned int nSize, const std::string& sName)
00105    {
00106       char* s = const_cast<char*>(sName.c_str()); 
00107           // This would be easier if std::string was the parameter type rather than char*.
00108       return new InstructionTypeT(nSize, s);
00109    }
00110 
00111    /**********************
00112    Function Name: virtual void Visit(const PDI::Array& array)
00113    Function Description: This function uses iterates over all items in the array. It calls a visit function
00114    on each item.  It passes in the name of the array for the same reason that we needed to pass the name of
00115    the root node into the constructor.  So that it would be available to use when we create the instruction.
00116 
00117    Each item in the array is added to an instruction set.
00118    ***********************/
00119    virtual void Visit(const PDI::Array& array) {
00120       if (m_bDisplayOutputToScreen)
00121       {
00122          std::cout << "This array node has been visited " << m_sName << ", dimension " << array.Dimension() << std::endl;
00123       }
00124 
00125       BabelShark::InstructionSet* pInstructionSet = new BabelShark::InstructionSet(array.Dimension(), (char*)m_sName.c_str()); // TODO: fix "char*"
00126       PDI::Array::const_iterator it(array.Begin()),
00127                                    itEnd(array.End());
00128       for (; it != itEnd; ++it)
00129       {
00130          TreeVisitor visitor(it->Name(), m_bDisplayOutputToScreen);
00131          it->Accept(visitor);
00132 
00133          pInstructionSet->Add(visitor.GetInstruction());
00134       }
00135 
00136       m_pInstruction = pInstructionSet;
00137    }
00138 
00139    /**********************
00140    Function Name: virtual void Visit(const PDI::DisplayElement& string)
00141    Function Description: This function is used to visit a DisplayElement.  
00142    It creates one instruction for the DisplayElement.  It uses a template
00143    in order to reduce code.  It looks in the function map for a known type
00144    and then calls the appropriate function to create the instruction that
00145    matches the desired type.  For example, if ASCII is the type, then an
00146    AsciiElement instruction is created and added to the instruction tree.
00147    ***********************/
00148    virtual void Visit(const PDI::DisplayElement& string) {
00149       std::istringstream ss(string);
00150 
00151       std::string sType;
00152       int nSize;
00153       ss >> sType >> nSize;
00154 
00155       CreateInstructionFuncMap::const_iterator it = m_CreateInstructionFuncMap.find(sType);
00156       if (it == m_CreateInstructionFuncMap.end())
00157       {
00158          std::string sException = "use of undefined type: " + sType;
00159          throw std::exception(sException.c_str());
00160       }
00161       else
00162       {
00163          if (m_bDisplayOutputToScreen)
00164          {
00165             std::cout << "This leaf node has been visited " << m_sName << " " << sType << " " << nSize << std::endl;
00166          }
00167       }
00168       
00169       CreateInstructionFunc func = it->second;
00170       m_pInstruction = (this->*func)(nSize, m_sName);
00171    }
00172 
00173    /**********************
00174    Function Name: virtual void Visit(const PDI::Null& null)
00175    Function Description: This function is used to visit a NULL_ELEMENT.  This was kept in for completeness.
00176    It's a good idea to still have the NULL_ELEMENT enum value so we can default the type of a new element to
00177    NULL_ELEMENT.  However, we should never be visiting a NULL_ELEMENT, so an exception in thrown.
00178    ***********************/
00179    virtual void Visit(const PDI::Null& null) { throw std::runtime_error("ERROR: should never see NULL element"); }
00180 
00181    typedef BabelShark::Instruction* (TreeVisitor::*CreateInstructionFunc)(unsigned int, const std::string&);
00182    typedef std::map<std::string, CreateInstructionFunc> CreateInstructionFuncMap;
00183 
00184    CreateInstructionFuncMap m_CreateInstructionFuncMap;
00185 
00186    std::string m_sName;
00187    BabelShark::Instruction* m_pInstruction;  // This is used so that one visit function may see the instruction from another.
00188    bool m_bDisplayOutputToScreen;
00189 };
